poem:
**By Any Name**

Forty years and more he walked  
beneath a sky too tight with stars,  
each one a witness. Faceless, 
time erodes even the hardest stone, 
turns brass into whispers.  
In the end, his name  
carved in smoke, scattered by wind,  
remembered by shadows  
that bleed through the dawn.
